alert.note: Alert for Stewart (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 02 at 6:25PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Stewart County through 700 PM EDT... At 625 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was near Providence Canyon State Park, or 9 miles west of Lumpkin, moving northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Up to 40 mph wind, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Lumpkin, Richland, Omaha, Charles, Sanford, Westville, Brooklyn, Louvale and Providence Canyon State Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning.
